str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From pleion; to do, make or be more, i.e. Increase; by extension, to superabound.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
Thankfulness, gratitude; giving of thanks, thanksgiving. From eucharistos; gratitude; actively, grateful language.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
